instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No chime.
threads.message:
Board has no liquid damage. No physical signs at all.

No light on USB mouse.
vcore good.

Tried another BIOS chip and got chime, USB mouse light up but nothing on screen. Noticed my error (did not read the board number properly and stuck a 3330 chips on) so put a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> BIOS chip on there, back to no chime no light on USB mouse.... Guess it's not the chip then.

What to check for please?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No chime.
threads.message: When you got chime did you check backlight output?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No chime.
threads.message:
[QUOTE="Repairable, post: 13015"]When you got chime did you check backlight output?[/QUOTE]

I did, it's a no image no backlight. Yes tried another screen / cable.

Tried 2 other BIOS chips from <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boards and both result in no chime...
Only thing I can guess is that the wrong BIOS is not checking for something that the correct one is and so POST hangs for one and not the other but that is just an uneducated guess. Truth be told I have no fucking clue what's going on here.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No chime.
threads.message: Heat the GPU (100C), it is probably dead.
